alert.note: Alert for Albemarle (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and western Virginia, including the following counties: in central Virginia, Albemarle, City of Charlottesville and Nelson. In western Virginia, Augusta, City of Staunton and City of Waynesboro. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlottesville... Staunton... Waynesboro... Stuarts Draft... Crozet... Crimora... Sherando... Shipman... Schuyler... Free Union... Wintergreen... Afton... Montebello... Campbell... Westmoreland... Hollymead... Fishersville... Verona... Weyers Cave... Lyndhurst... - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
